headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: Fani Willis' Father Testifies At Disqualification Hearing. Aired 11:30a-12p ET

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes. She did. She had -- she had a boyfriend when I first got there.

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: And did you meet her boyfriend?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Many -- often.

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: OK. And can -- did you know him by any specific nickname?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Deuce. ABBATE

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Who can't --

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: Can you tell the court why you were living there? How often would you see him?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Sometimes every day. Sometimes, you know, every other day. He was a disc jockey or something. And he had all this paraphernalia that I'd have to move out.It was a -- you know, a thing with the key -- covering up. Things that play music and so forth, so --

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: Now, when you moved in, in 2019 and then throughout the years, and you're 2020 or 21, had you ever met someone named Nathan Wade?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I did not meet Nathan Wade until 2023, about a year ago when I -- reporter by the name of Isikoff (PH) interviewed me. I may have -- that's the first time I met him.

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: You said that was in 2023?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: 2023. Right.

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: And I know you said you hadn't met him until 2023. But when you were living at Miss Willis's house in Fulton County, did you ever meet Mr. Wade in the year 2019?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Absolutely, not.

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: How about in the year 2020?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Absolutely, not.

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: Do you ever see Mr. Wade at Miss Willis's Fulton County house in the year 2021?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Never.

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: And is it your testimony that the only time or the first time that you met Mr. Wade was in 2023?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Let me say something. Mr. Wade said that he remembers seeing me. And I do remember some banter.I'm a member of the Kappa Alpha Psi fraternity. And there's kind of this thing that goes on between 30s. And Mr. Wade as a member of Alpha Phi Alpha, and they -- you know, so that -- I do remember there was some kind of banter when my daughter was sworn in to be District Attorney between me and a couple of guys. And he said he remembers me. I don't remember him.

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: And prior to that experience that you're talking about, as well as I guess your official meeting in 2023, have you ever even heard his name? FLOYD

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: I don't think I have further questions, Your Honor.

utterances.speaker: SCOTT MCAFEE, JUDGE, FULTON COUNTY SUPERIOR COURT
utterances.sentences: Ms. Merchant.

utterances.speaker: ASHLEIGH MERCHANT, DEFENSE ATTORNEY FOR MIKE ROMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes. thank you, Judge. Good morning. How are you today?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Fine. How are you, counsel?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Good. Thank you. I just got a couple of questions. On Monday, we heard you were in California. Do you have a place in California?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: People always ask me about where do I live. I guess I live right here, sitting in this seat right now. But yes, the answer is I have a place in Los Angeles.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: All right, you do. All right. And so, do you share time -- split time between Los Angeles and Georgia?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, do you own property in California?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No. I don't. I live with a friend of mine.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Live with a friend of yours. OK.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And when did you first move -- let me -- let me qualify with the dates. Did you spend any time in 2019 in California?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No. And the reason I didn't is that when I first came here -- the answer is no. I did not.What happened was COVID. Once COVID hit, that -- I mean, I was just paralyzed. I couldn't go any place. I couldn't do anything. I mean, I'm a theater buff. I used to go to the theater, at least once a week. But when COVID hit, I just couldn't. I couldn't go to the dentist, which I need to do. Well, you know, I just -- it was just a thing. So, I was just stuck. I was just stuck there.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I may be wrong, but I believe COVID hit and 2020. So, I was asking about 2019. In 2019, did you spend any time in California?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Before COVID was even here in the United States.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Remember, I lived in South Africa, and I've traveled the world. I knew COVID was coming before. I knew COVID was around before.They may have announced it in '20. But in fact, I knew about it. And I knew what was happening in '19.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: OK. So, let's walk through 2019 then. You said you moved here in September? So --

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No, I didn't say that. I moved here probably prior to September. In September, is when I got the driver's license. I probably moved in the springtime.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry. You didn't. You said spring or summer. I see that in my notes.So, spring or summer 2019 is when you moved here. So, up until spring or summer of 2019, where did you live?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I live in Johannesburg -- well, I lived in Washington, D.C. 2018. I plan to retire for the rest of my life in South Africa. I had worked for Nelson Mandela and the Free Mandela and got that. And someone I'd gone to law school, he had relocated there after Mandela was freed from prison and became president.I was going to live there for the rest of my life. But unfortunately, because of political reasons, I could not stay in South Africa. And I was forced, in a sense, to come back to the United States.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, let's just focus in on the period from -- let's see -- let's just start with October 2019. OK. We'll call that the relevant period.October 2019 until the end of 2019, were you in Georgia every single day of that year?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, now let's move to 2020, OK? And every single day -- before I move on, every single day in 2019, you slept at your daughter's house, correct?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, let's start in 2020, all right? So, 2020 the entire year, did you travel anywhere?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. You didn't travel at all that year?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Not -- no.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: And I didn't go to the movies which upset me also.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, that entire year 2020, you remained here in Georgia.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. In 2021, did you do any traveling?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, when did you move back or when did you start this documentary film in Los Angeles?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: What I had been doing to occupy my time as I was writing my own memoir. As I delved into my family background, I discovered something and that's what got me to working on the documentary. So, I want you to understand what was going on in my life.I pitched my -- I have a movie script called "Bad Blood." I have a movie script which I'm trying to sell. So, I tried to sell that -- I just happened to mention something that happened during the Civil Rights Movement. Snake -- it's called "The Snake Five." The legendary Peter FitzSimons was interested. And so, with Peter FitzSimons and Noya Smith (PH) were now doing the documentaries.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I don't -- I don't want to interrupt you, but what I was asking was when you moved to Los Angeles, not what you moved there for.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: You keep saying moved. I haven't moved to Los Angeles. I spent more time in California, in Oakland, if you really want to just be because Peter is basically San Francisco-based. So, we're working on a documentary.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You still own property in Washington, D.C., correct?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You don't own property at 1467 Roxanna Road Northwest?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: That's where I used to live.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: That's where you used to live.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Did you own that property?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And you owned that property when you moved here in 2019?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And you owned it in 2020, correct?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Well, that -- well, you -- now, you talk about a very complicated issue. I left the property. There was a dispute between me and -- I had gotten a reverse mortgage company. And there was a dispute between me, and they diverted that. And I just walked away from it.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. You walked away from it with almost $300,000?

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: Yes. What is the relevance of that?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Where he live and register to vote? That's what they brought in. So, that's --

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: It was the money you got. That's not relevant at all.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: It's the only proof I have of that he owned that address. So, I can move on now.

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. When did you sell that property?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I didn't. The reverse mortgage company took it.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, in 2019, when you -- when you got your driver's license here --

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: The next day, you registered to vote, correct?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I think it may have been the same day but maybe it was the next day. I don't remember.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: But you didn't own property here in Georgia that day?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No, I was living with my daughter.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. You said that you met Mr. Wade -- that you remember you met in 2023, right? That was the first time you remember.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And I wasn't really clear. You said something about meeting him. Was it with Mr. Isikoff or did Mr. Isikoff tell you?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No. I was being interviewed by Mr. Isikoff.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: And he walked in. And I met him. It was the first time. He walked into the office. And --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Where were you being interviewed?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: At the district attorney's office.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And Mr. Wade walked into that interview?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And so, you're -- so, Miss Willis had not told you about Mr. Wade prior to that?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Absolutely not.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, she didn't tell you anything about their relationship before you met him that day?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: But Mr. Wade remembers meeting you in 2020?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: He said that at my daughter's swearing, he had. I do remember that we haven't some banter about fraternities. But other than that --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Oh, at your daughter's swearing in? OK.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: That's all I have. Just one moment, Judge. I think I -- (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: STEVE SADOW, DEFENSE ATTORNEY FOR DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Morning, sir.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Good morning. How are you, Counsel?

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: I'm fine. I'll try to ask you some specific questions if we can. OK?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: And I'll give specific answers if I can.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Perfect.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: The driver's license address, I'm not going to publish, that is State's Exhibit number two. But is the address on that driver's license the home that you're referring to as your daughter's in South Fulton?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. It was unclear to me, maybe no one else, but it's unclear to me. When did you stop living at what I would call your daughter's home in South Fulton?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Things got so bad. And threats got so many even against me that the house became basically uninhabitable. You know, I got tired of sleeping in one room one day and not one that, I would say December of 2022, something like that.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: December of 2022?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Right. That's about right. Yes.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Not only change and go back for another date. You had indicated and I didn't hear it. When was your daughter, Miss Willis, when was she sworn in as district attorney?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: On January 1, 2021.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. And did you indicate that there was an incident -- and I know you've described it. Was that incident on February 3, 2021?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: That's my best recollection.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. So, my question then is after February 3, 2021, how much longer did Miss Willis stay at the house before she moved somewhere else?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: A very short period of time. And I cannot be precise, but I would bet all the money I ever made, it wouldn't work in more than a month and a half with that home.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. So, we're talking about best of your recollection, end of February into the beginning of March, give or take, of 2021 when Miss Willis would have moved to a different location?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: From time to time, she and her security might show up for her to pick something up or take something on -- something. But she always would be come with her security.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. My question was poorly worded. I apologize. Did she come back permanently to her house?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Absolutely not.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. FLOYD

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: So, as far as you're aware that once Miss Willis left the house -- her house, her Fulton house, so the record's clear, in either late February or into March of 2021, best of your recollection, she's not returned to that home to live?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No, she -- no. It became uninhabitable. I mean, it just -- you know, I mean --

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: That's OK.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I would have to walk around that house looking out of every window. I had -- I had -- I made a habit of having to walk around the whole house. I got lights so that if somebody would come at night in the back, so that -- those kinds of reflecting lights. I had those put up, you know. you're not --

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: I don't really in -- all I was interested in is whether she had ever returned?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No. The answer is no.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. Now, when Miss Willis -- when your daughter left the home, the time period ended February beginning of March, give or take 2021, do you know where she moved to?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No. And I didn't want to know. I intentionally did not want to know. Because I was not -- you know, if somebody stuck a gun to my head, and I could tell him I wasn't going to tell them anyway. I have to made up something. But I didn't want to know.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. So, would it be fair to say that if you didn't want to know, you never visited her at the place that she moved to?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Oh, I never did.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Never did?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I never did.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. Do you know how long she stayed at the first place that she went to after she left her house before she moved to a second place?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: What I know -- and this is hearsay, Counsel, is that my daughter has had to move something like four times.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: But do you know any potential --

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No, I don't know any place. I was taken one time for Christmas day. I've only seen my daughter -- and this is very hard for me to say. But during the period, my daughter left, I've only seen my daughter 13 times because I can't. And we've never seen each other more than maybe three hours because of, you know, the nightmare threats against her and me. SADOWSo, let me try to get one more date. In 2023 when you were being interviewed by one of the gentlemen that wrote the book, at the D.A.'s office, and Mr. Wade came in, can you give us other than 2023 what the date would be?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry, I can't, Counsel.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: How about spring or summer? Any idea?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I would guess spring or summer, but I can't. I don't -- I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: And you've already indicated, at least to your recollection, that was the first time that you've met Mr. Wade, right?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. Not arguing with you about that. I want to go to Miss Willis's boyfriend that you referenced. OK? You met Miss Willis's boyfriend as you've characterized it, when you came here in 2019?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: And you met him on one occasion -- several occasions?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Oh, no. I saw him often.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, so you mean, there was no secret that she was dating this man?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Not from me.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Not from you?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: And that's -- he was -- again, he was a disc jockey of some kind. I think he had a government job during the day. I don't know what it was.But apparently, he would do weddings and so forth and so on. He was a disc jockey. He played music. So, all of his -- all of his stuff was always in the way. And I was always having to try to push it aside, you know. Anyway.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: But Miss Willis, your daughter, didn't keep him from you, correct?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: No? I mean, there was no doubt he --

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I mean, that we lived in my daughter, and I lived in the same house. I mean, you know, he came and went. You know. SADOW

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: About seven weeks ago when it -- as a matter of fact, I just found out when other folks found out. OK?

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: That is your daughter, as I understand it, never told you one time in the year of 2022 that she was dating Mr. Wade, correct?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: That is whatever the relationship is between father and daughter, she kept that a secret from you, correct?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: That's all I need to know.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Stockton.

utterances.speaker: ALLYN STOCKTON, DEFENSE ATTORNEY FOR RUDY GIULIANI
utterances.sentences: Good morning, Mr. Floyd.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Good morning, Counsel.

utterances.speaker: STOCKTON
utterances.sentences: When your daughter moved or left the house that she owned, did she say anything to you about having a large savings of cash?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Oh, no. She -- oh, no. That -- see? Maybe -- excuse me. And I -- Your Honor, I'm not trying to be racist, OK? But it's a black thing, OK?You know, I was trained. And most black folks, they hide cash, or they keep cash. And I was -- no, I train. You always keep some cash because I've been places. And just because of the color of my skin, for example, I took a fellowship at Harvard, when my daughter was just -- if I might, Your Honor, or my -- when I was just -- she was just, you know, maybe three years old. And I remember going to a restaurant in Cambridge, Massachusetts. And I had a American Express credit card and maybe a visa or whatever. And I had a lot of what they call traveler's checks. I don't even know if they still have traveler's checks, but traveler's checks. And there was a sign that said, you know -- with a credit card, for whatever reasons, the man would not take my American Express credit card. So, I pulled up my Visa card, and he wouldn't take my Visa card. So, then I pulled out my traveler's checks. He said we don't take checks. Now, this was -- (INAUDIBLE) traveler's checks. This was money. I had a $10 bill. I'll never forget this as long as I live. And he said, the bill for my wife at the time, Fani's mother, Fani, and myself was like $9.95, and I had a $10 bill. It was all that -- I always remember that. But even before that, I've always kept cash, you know. And I've told my daughter, you keep six months' worth of cash always. For example, I had three safes in my house. I put some of my clients' stuff there too, things I didn't want other lawyers to be. I mean -- because you're always in a firm, and I knew that there were special conditions. So, some of my clients' things I would bring home, put them in the safe. But I've always kept saves. And as a matter of fact, I gave my daughter her first cash box and told her to always keep some cash.

utterances.speaker: STOCKTON
utterances.sentences: So, is that a yes?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: STOCKTON
utterances.sentences: That's all I got, Judge.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Durham.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No more questions.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Mr. MacDougald?

utterances.speaker: HARRY MCDOUGALD, DEFENSE ATTORNEY FOR JEFFREY CLARK
utterances.sentences: No more questions, Your Honor.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Mr. Rice?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No questions, Your Honor.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Gillen?

utterances.speaker: CRAIG GILLEN, DEFENSE ATTORNEY FOOR DAVID SHAFER
utterances.sentences: It's still morning. Good morning, sir.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Good morning, Counsel. How are you?

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Just fine. Just a few questions following up. When -- you were talking about when you learned about Mr. Wade and your daughter, correct?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Now, did your daughter tell you in around October of 2022 that she had gone on a Caribbean cruise with Mr. Wade to the Bahamas?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: The answer is I knew that my daughter had gone but I did not know who she went with or what the circumstances were. So, I knew that she had gone out of town, but I didn't know with whom. GILLEN

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: The answer was -- again, I knew she went on a tour. I didn't know where she went. I knew she was going out of town. She told me she was going out of town. I think she might have said she was going out of the country as to whom she'd be gone. But other than that, that was all.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: OK. And did she tell you in March of 2023, that she was going to Belize for several days with Mr. Wade?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: The answer -- that's the same answer that I knew she would tell me she was going out of town. And she may or may not have told me where she was going. But she'd be gone for a couple of days.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: OK. Now, in 2023, you are -- you are -- in many days, you would be out in California, correct?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Some days I'd be in California, correct?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: The answer is no.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: And so, the first time that you ever met Mr. Wade or learned about Mr. Wade, to your recollection was in 2023?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: That's all I have, Your Honor. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Kucherov (PH) on the Zoom.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, Your Honor. Just a couple of quick questions. Good morning, sir. I know I can't see you.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I can't see you either. But --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: But we could take a moment. We can --

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Good morning. Counsel.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: We take a moment. Let's just pause and see if we can change the screens to show Mr. Kucherov.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: OK. We need you --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK. I'm on a -- I'm on a phone so it's kind of difficult.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Can you turn your screen on now?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'm trying to.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: JOHN BERMAN, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: All right. You're watching John Floyd, who is the father of Fani Willis on the witness stand here. And one of the things he has testified to is that during the time he lived with his daughter prior to the case against Donald Trump and others being taken up, that he had never met Nathan Wade. Nathan Wade had never been to the home where he lived.And he also testified to the fact that he taught his daughter to keep large amounts of cash at her home. And that's become an issue because both Fani Willis and Nathan Wade has said they exchanged cash to basically both pay for the various things that they did together. Let's listen to the testimony again. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Did you speak with your daughter about your testimony?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: She may have been present when the lawyers were. I just -- I really don't remember.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: If Mr. Wade and your daughter were dating, you wouldn't have known that unless your daughter told you.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: What are you -- maybe I'm not understanding your question, Counsel. So, maybe you want to restate. What is it that you're asking me?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes. If it wasn't clear, I can re-ask the question. I'll rephrase it.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Right -- yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: If Mr. Wade -- if Mr. Wade and your daughter were dating, you wouldn't have known that unless your daughter told you.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I did not know that they were dating.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: And when we were talking about the case, I didn't know that -- I don't know what you're -- what you're asking me. What I told my child from the time she was a child is always to have some money. Always have some money. If you go on a date so that people don't try to stick you and you want to leave whoever, always keep some cash. OK?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Floyd, I -- you answer the question that the attorneys prepped you for that. So, that's all I wanted to know.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Is that all Mr. Kucherov?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That's it, Your Honor.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right. Mr. Cromwell?

utterances.speaker: BILL CROMWELL, DEFENSE ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: No questions, Your Honor.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Abbate?

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Your Honor. Mr. Floyd, now, it wasn't common for your daughter to confide in you about her romantic life at all.

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: No. And I didn't -- I haven't confided in her about mine before when I had one, OK?

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: And you wouldn't have known about her boyfriend that this time --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Do we have an objection?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I think there might have just been still off mute.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: OK, let's keep going.

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: Now, you wouldn't have known about her boyfriend, the disc jockey had you not been living with her, correct?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Overruled.

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: I had nothing further.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Do you -- do you answer the question?

utterances.speaker: ABBATE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right, by show of hands, any redirect on those points only. Ms. Merchant.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes. I just wanted to when you were prepped by the lawyers. When this prep session was?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: I just got off the plane on a Tuesday night. I think I was probably drooling at the mouth. I was so tired. So, it must have been -- I got it on Wednesday -- it must be Wednesday.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And did you talk about any of the testimony from yesterday or watching the news reports or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Oh, absolutely -- you can't cut the T.V. on without seeing this. The first thing. And I listened to conservative radio a lot -- and, you know, last night for five hours, and all they talked about was this case. MERCHANT

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Yes. How -- I mean, how could -- I mean, unless you don't cut the radio on unless you don't cut the television on unless you don't read the AJC or any other -- New York Times or whatever, which I do every day, yes, of course.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, is it fair to say nobody instructed you that you were under the rule of sequestration?

utterances.speaker: FLOYD
utterances.sentences: Right. And I'm not under subpoena either.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right. Anything else? Seeing and hearing none. Thank you, Mr. Floyd.
